text:
Michał Urbaniak (born January 22, 1943) is a Polish jazz musician. He plays violin, lyricon, and saxophone. His music includes elements of folk music, rhythm and blues, hip hop, and symphonic music.
History.
Urbaniak started his music education during high school in Łódź, Poland. When he was in Warsaw then he took violin classes from Tadeusz Wroński. His first play was for Dixieland band and later with Zbigniew Namysłowski. Later he was invited to play with Andrzej Trzaskowski and travelled the United States in 1962 with the Andrzej Trzaskowski band. He has played in various festivals and clubs in Newport, San Francisco, Chicago, Washington, and New York City etc.
